web_apache/mpm.description: Defines the multi-processing module setting in httpd.conf. Use 'worker' for Rails/Tomcat/Standalone frontends and 'prefork' for PHP. Example: prefork

web_apache/ssl_certificate.description: The name of your SSL Certificate. Example: cred:SSL_CERT

web_apache/ssl_certificate_chain.description: Your SSL Certificate Chain. Example: cred:SSL_CERT_CHAIN

web_apache/ssl_key.description: Your SSL Certificate Key. Example: cred:SSL_KEY

web_apache/application_name.description: Sets the directory for your application's web files (/home/webapps/Application Name/). If you have multiple applications, you can run the code checkout script multiple times, each with a different value for the 'Application Name' input, so each application will be stored in a unique directory. This must be a valid directory name. Do not use symbols in the name. Example: myapp

web_apache/allow_override.description: Allows/disallows the use of .htaccess files in project web root directory. Can be None (default), All, or any directive-type as specified in Apache documentation. Example: None

recipes.web_apache::install_apache: Installs and configures the Apache2 webserver.
recipes.web_apache::setup_frontend: Sets up front-end apache vhost. Select ssl_enabled for SSL.
recipes.web_apache::setup_frontend_ssl_vhost: Sets up front-end apache vhost with SSL enabled.
recipes.web_apache::setup_frontend_http_vhost: Sets up front-end apache vhost on port 80.
recipes.web_apache::setup_monitoring: Installs the collectd-apache plugin for monitoring support.
recipes.web_apache::do_enable_maintenance_mode: Enables maintenance mode for Apache2 webserver
recipes.web_apache::do_disable_maintenance_mode: Disables maintenance mode for Apache2 webserver
